sentence: Stepan Company ( SCL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on August 28, 2013.
A cash dividend payment of $0.16 per share is scheduled to be paid on September 13, 2013.
Shareholders who purchased SCL stock prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This marks the 3rd quarter that SCL has paid the same dividend.
At the current stock price of $58.57, the dividend yield is 1.09%.
The previous trading day's last sale of SCL was $58.57, representing a -9.88% decrease from the 52 week high of $64.99 and a 30.47% increase over the 52 week low of $44.89.
SCL is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
SCL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $3.39.
Zacks Investment Research reports SCL's forecasted earnings growth in 2013 as 3.44%, compared to an industry average of 4.6%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the SCL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
